title: Mark Vernon - On Dante, Barfield, and the Possibility of Light Getting In
description:
Mark Vernon is a writer and psychotherapist interested in topics of psychology, spirituality, and our inner lives. He has written an excellent guide to Dante's Commedia, lauded by other insightful contemporaries such as Susanna Clarke, Iain McGilchrist, and David Bentley Hart.

I was pleased to have him on the program to discuss Dante, the "Last Inkling" Owen Barfield, and their relevance to both our troubled age & our individual selves.

Contents:
0:00 – Introduction
2:26 – Mark Vernon's new guide to Dante, and his relationship with the Divine Comedy
6:30 – Mark shows us around Dante's hell, and its psychological meaning
19:03 – Purgatory is the point at which our suffering still exists, but we aren't overwhelmed by it anymore
24:54 – Why do we overlook Paradise?
29:18 – An introduction to Owen Barfield and the “fossils of human consciousness”
34:57 – Is there a connection between Dante and Barfield's Orignal and Final Participation?
37:24 – Free Will: can we believe in it in our age?
43:22 – Are there rooms in our minds that our materialist age has sealed off?
48:20 – Hierarchy and morality in our time and Dante's
53:58 – Is our alienation getting worse?
56:51 – Can we pursue “One-ness” without obliterating ourselves entirely? (Please?)
1:01:29 – What actually happened to Dante? What did he experience that produced the Commedia?
1:05:53 – What is Mark working on now?

Mark's Youtube Channel: 
https://www.youtube.com/user/PlatosPodcasts

Mark's Twitter:
https://twitter.com/platospodcasts

More relvant links on TheCommonToad blog page:
https://www.thecommontoad.com/single-post/conversations-mark-vernon-on-dante-barfield-and-the-possibility-of-light-getting-in
